report_title: Industry Research: Concrete Pipe Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: The Concrete Pipe Manufacturing industry has encountered harsh and inconsistent operating conditions over the past five years, causing revenue to fluctuate significantly. Manufacturers make concrete pipes, which are used in a wide variety of construction projects, both residential and nonresidential. Industry pipes are frequently used for sewage and storm drains; industry revenue is highly dependent on utilities construction and public infrastructure investment. Over the past five years, the value of utility construction has swung inconsistently, while the value of other nonresidential construction dropped overall; both were exacerbated by COVID-19, causing industry revenue to fall in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Infrastructure Investment Act Fuels Demand for Concrete Pipes
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act represents a $1.2 trillion investment, $550 billion above the baseline. By the first half of 2024, more than $454 billion in Bipartisan Infrastructure Law funding has been allocated to numerous projects enhancing national infrastructure.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition from Substitute Products is Rising
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufacturers face intense competition from substitute products like cellulose fiber cement pipes, which are lighter and more cost-effective than conventional concrete pipes.
Cement, the key ingredient in concrete, significantly influences industry revenue through its pricing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue Performance Will Be Driven By Rebounding Growth in Nonresidential Construction
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will continue to raise demand for concrete pipes through higher infrastructure spending over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Eco-Friendly Concrete Products Will Boost Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As environmental concerns grow, Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED)-certified buildings have become increasingly popular among contractors.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technological Advancements Will Spur Industry Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry has seen significant technological advancements, improving production efficiency, product quality and sustainability.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Government Investment Will Support Demand for Concrete Pipe Manufacturing
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will notably impact this industry, enhancing demand for concrete pipes.

industry_definition: Firms in this industry manufacture concrete piping, which includes: storm sewer pipes, sanitary sewer pipes, reinforced pressure pipes, and culvert pipe production.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

key_trends: The industry faces heightened competition because of urbanization and demand for sustainable materials.
Manufacturers are under pressure to reduce costs and operate more efficiently.
Green initiatives are urging manufacturers to develop low-emission concretes.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The residential building market includes the construction of single-family homes and apartment buildings.
In the infrastructure building market, concrete pipes are used in construction.
The nonresidential building market includes commercial and institutional buildings.

products_and_services.product_description: Concrete storm and sanitary pipes help prevent flooding.
Culvert pipes are extensions of sewer pipes.
Includes reinforced pressure pipes and prestressed cylinder pressure pipes.

tier_1_suppliers: Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Water Supply & Irrigation Systems in the US
Sand & Gravel Mining in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: This industry depends on infrastructure investment.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Canada Is The Largest Source Of Imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: The concrete pipe industry relies on local production.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports Will Continue to Satisfy a Low Level of Domestic Demand
international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports will rise but will remain a minor component of overall market consumption.
High transportation costs limit the export market.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Demand for High Quality Products Will Rise
international_trade_points.trade_description: Developing countries have an increasing demand for high-quality concrete materials.

business_locations.location_description: The southeastern US has abundant raw materials.
The Great Lakes region has a large population.
The western part of the US has experienced significant population growth.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Concrete pipe manufacturing can produce waste materials.
Manufacturing concrete pipes involves risks to workers.
Manufacturers must comply with building codes.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The revenue volatility level is very high.
The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The competition level is high and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers must differentiate themselves to remain competitive.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Smaller Manufacturers Cater to Local Markets
concentration_points.concentration_description: Various small manufacturers capture most of the market.
Ownership concentration within the industry has increased significantly.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases Are The Most Significant Expense For Manufacturers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers require significant raw materials to produce the final output.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Concrete pipe manufacturing requires specialized machinery and equipment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Nonresidential Construction Market Has Been Volatile
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry is sensitive to private nonresidential and infrastructure construction trends.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This type of concrete uses high-flowing mixtures that improve efficiency.

FAQs.question: What is the American Concrete Pipe Association?
FAQs.answer: The association represents companies in this industry, providing a network to share information and assisting manufacturers with government advocacy.

FAQs.question: What is the National Concrete Masonry Association?
FAQs.answer: The association provides this assistance to companies in this industry and other industries involving manufacturing concrete products.
